body:

******

replies.body:
With Kai'Sa being released, we have run into an age old problem again. Players are banning the champion in ranked to not have to play with teammates who don't know what they are doing on her yet, and then the players who wanted to play her are trolling their teammates in revenge.

**Please for the love of god, why are new releases enabled in ranked during the first week?**

Yeah, i feel you, instalock and "___ main btw" on release day is a recipe for feeding

Tbh i think the answer to this is outside the scope of this AMA/team, but I'll forward your question to some other Rioters and see if we can get you an actual answer.
Thank you so much!

another Rioter pointed me to this as well - probably not the answer you were looking for, but this is the latest we've said on the topic: https://nexus.leagueoflegends.com/en-us/2017/04/ask-riot-should-new-champs-be-disabled-in-ranked/

Yeah, that's definitely not the answer I was looking for. :(

As an alternative do you think it might be an idea worth considering to enable one-for-all when a new release comes out? I just want what is best for everyone involved. Players who want to try her should be able to try her, and players who take ranked seriously shouldn't have to be dragged down by "_ mains" on release day.

_For people who don't like clicking links but want to follow along below is Ghostcrawler's answer to the question about restricting new releases from ranked:_

> Releasing a new champion or a major champion update is a big deal for us and for players, especially at the slower release cadence we use these days. After the teasing and the hype and the spotlights, we want players to be able to try the champion out right away. For players whose primary way to engage in League is through ranked (and that’s a lot of players) a week can feel like a long time, especially since the champion will have been on the PBE before that.

> However, we sympathize with the basic problem you’re hinting at, of someone going into ranked with a champion they have never played before, and having your team possibly pay the price. While we think the new Practice Mode will help some with this problem, we also have discussed requiring you to play with the champion – even if it’s as little as one game – before you take him or her into ranked. No concrete plans at the moment, but it’s something we’ll keep on our radar.
Now that I think about it, wouldn't it be easier to have people play in blind pick? You can multiples of the same champ right?
Yep! That would work, although not quite as well as one-for-all, because with blind-pick there would still be conflicts over insta-locking and role calling.
Don't forget, that's just a writer. Not exactly involved with the topic you're concerned with. Never mind me if you acknowledge this.
Yep, I know. And he did mention that he would see if anyone who knew the answer could help. No worries, I knew what I was doing when I asked.

I still have the highest rated comment on that article, pasting here:

> Your answer on new champions in ranked is woefully inadequate:
> 
> "But it was on the PBE, they already have practice": call me when everyone has access to the PBE instead of a nearly microscopic group and also when you yourselves do not regularly complain about how bad the PBE is for balance calls.
> 
> "A lot of people mainly play ranked": that doesn't disable normals for their account, they can stand to play a couple games outside of ranked for one week every few months.
> 
> You didn't address the fact that players already enforce this by default: new champs are permaban status regardless of their balance state. Basically it just robs teams of a ban or someone forgets to ban it and the quality of the game drops to shit because this wildcard champ enters the game and either feeds or gets fed because the player/other players don't know how it works yet.
> 
> "It's on our radar, we're looking into it": People have been complaining about this for years, Riot employees have been answering this question for years, an easy and fair solution that similar games have engaged in has been proposed and shot down with little reasoning and now your answer sounds like you're just in the mood to overthink this issue.

I know it's not your choice DyQuill, so this isn't directed at you. This is to anyone who's choice it is.

The answer of "people want to play it, but also don't want to play non ranked games" is not remotely good enough. Especially because those very people often also have a terrible experience when they in fact do this, in addition to ruining things for everyone else. I think the main reason this still goes on is because new stuff sells and not allowing the new champion in ranked for a week would hurt sales in a very clear, measurable, though short term way. Whereas the cost of doing so is much more long term, nearly impossible to measure, and probably pretty damn small anyways. Why have a better player experience when you can just not and make more money? I also wouldn't be surprised if this is the sort of thing where that decision happened long ago for that greedy reason, but if it were a new problem Riot wouldn't do it that way now and the main thing preventing change is the inertia of the situation.

As Ghostcrawler said, the practice tool (and now the much more open PBE) likely mitigate this a good amount. I just got done playing a ranked game where the adc on my team was Kai'Sa. They did well enough and as a team we crushed our opponents. But I still think letting people play brand new champions out the game with no requirement in ranked is stupid and overall makes the game worse. I also think there are better solutions than simply making people wait a week though and I hope Riot gives this some real thought and effort and makes a change. Sure we won and our Kai'Sa's record looks good (6/2/5) but her damage was actually pretty bad, even lower than the enemy adc (who went 1/2/2), and her other contributions to the team were minimal at best. Regardless of the anecdote of this one experience, I'm pretty sure the evidence is strong that change should happen here.
should be two weeks honestly.
Maybe, but I'm setting my goals lower so as to not be rude or create high expectations.
Its not rude to stop people from intentionally being liabilities in a ranked game.

"I’m with you, but the situation is fraught
You’ve got to be carefully taught
If you talk, you’re gonna get shot" [down]

-Aaron Burr, in "My Shot" from the play Hamilton

I don't know if designy questions can go here, and that if I'm already too late to the questions, but...

How come Kai'Sa still looks "pretty" under that suit? Isn't the Void supposed to be some kind of "hell" that turn people into monsters in just two weeks (like Rasho in Nami's comic)?

People seem to not be impressed by the fact that the locals saw her as a monster, and that a lot of us couldn't *see* why. What's Riot's stance on that?

My understanding is that the suit protects her from the worst of the void, its corruption included. In the story, her mask had instinctually covered her head, so they didn't really see her human side in that moment. Given the danger of the Void, they're not wrong to be wary, but her attempts to convince the common folk she's a good guy are probably tales for later stories. That said, I don't think she's certain she's _not_ a danger. Who knows what the suit could do if it felt threatened? And she's kinda stuck with it

The biggest question remains how she got the suit though. I find it extremely hard to believe one simply happens upon a benevolent life form who for some reason has a different operating script than every other Void creature out there.
If I remember correctly in her lore she killed some voidborn and it kinda attached to her. The void is a weird place

don't you love the plothole of a 5-year-old killing a voidspawn and then the voidspawn decides to magically make the 5-year-old nigh-invincible to the void?

clearly that's not contrived at AAAAAAAAALLLLLLLL


/s
I think she was 10 actually. The problem i have with it is if a child could kill it, then it was pretty weak, but it make her super strong
So she's not even able to take it off? Can she remove sections of it, like the helmet? How does she sustain herself (does she need to eat, drink, sleep)?

The helmet "folds" into itself.   Think a biological equivalent to those really fancy sci-fi helms that have a bajillion moving parts that allow it to fold off of the head while not in active use.

Note that unlike those fancy sci-fi helms, a biological equivalent actually could potentially function decently enough to do the intended job.
Why the cleavage?
She can turn on her helmet to cover it.
I know, it just feels weird to have it in the first place.

I'd like to know more about the one thing that matters the most pertaining to Kai'sa's lore.

How did she meet/come across her second skin, what was it really, and why hasn't it devoured her alive yet? She may be a champion, but 10-years old Kaisa wasn't actually one at that absolutely crucial point in time. Telling us 'she's unique' just sounds like a convenient excuse without any meat to it, to be honest. 

We've had some rather shorthanded answers from Rioters that all failed to actually answer this in detail. To exemplify how frustrating this is; Imagine you released Varus' lore update without ever confirming that Varus was a Darkin, or Quinn and Valor without telling us how they came to be a team.

Her lore story goes over it though.  She killed the void creature with a dagger through the... heart?ish? and used it's body as a shield against the others.  It sort of glued itself to her arm though, and the carapace grew over her body from there.

As the various void creature champs have shown, the void can produce sentient creatures.  Killing the "mind" of the creature, but not the flesh, may have just left the flesh searching for something to sustain itself, and bonding with her body produced the result.  As she says, the suit itches like pins and needles across her flesh.  Probably because it infact has injected her flesh with various pins and needles to absorb sustenance from her body.

Why did you choose to make HER Kassadin daughter ? From early concepts I understand it was a marksman that became the monster he hunted (With the symbiosis, it still sticks closely to early concepts)

Wasn't there an heavy risk in making her Kassadin's daughter since there was probably high expectations and anticipation ? 

Also you did tease her with Swain new VO, is it a future trend for new champions or reworks ? (He also teases Irelia's lore)

Not exactly a question, but her waveclear 'combo' looks stunning in-game.

Also it does double dmg to minions that are below 35% so it gets pretty nutty in the proper hands^^"

Overall GJ on her Q.
On a more champion related note: What are your favorite builds to use as her?
Lots of thoughts here: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/oEEngRkl-what-do-i-build-on-kaisa
Thanks! Any thoughts about temporarily restricting releases from ranked in the future?

I think it's interesting to see a champ like Kai'Sa that can be built a lot of different ways.

What are the general builds you envision for her and in what situations do you think players should choose to build that way (AP, AD, on-hit, mixed, tanky?, etc.)

I suspect that if she ends up properly balanced, she'll have 4 different builds.

AD assassin/carry, Full Hybrid (Getting all 3 evos, using Gunblade, Rageblade, and BorK with Zerker greaves), full on hit focus, and then AP-ish artillery.  I say ish on that final one because her W has better AD/slot effeciency ratios than AP ratios, as 60 AD grants it 90 damage while 100 AP only grants it 65 damage.

Said final build has some fairly interesting things going on.   You go Warrior>Gunblade for the AD jungling into mid game, and then the moment you hit gunblade you can grab sorcs and start building Ludens.  Ludens finish sets your W up to absolutely chunk stuff, and you can follow up with Lichbane for commiting to fights, Morello for even stronger poke, or grab other defensive AP choices such as Banshee or Zhonya's.

> [{quoted}](name=DyQuill,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=fc374lQY,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-03-08T20:48:31.093+0000)We've got writers, artists, designers, engineers, and more who worked on Kai'Sa and want to tell you all about it. So what do you wanna know?

A question for the designers and playtesters:

Given the rather large differences in her damage potential with upgraded Q between 1 shot landing and 12 shots landing, at any point did you consider leaving on a permanent, Evelynn-like AoE around her for her Q range, or a particle effect on all current targets that gives some estimate of your impact to each? I've found it rather difficult in practice to determine exactly how much of my damage will go to any one given target (or how many will hit my primary target in the case of multiple enemies), which is frustrating when using her ult to finish off someone with a dive-- something that feels intended by her design, but often ruined by Q suddenly fragmenting into a minion wave. The difference between a step in one direction or a step in the other is an enormous damage loss against a specific target, and I'm wondering if this is something you found decreases significantly as the player's familiarity with her kit increases.

I had assumed, from the spotlight, that I could select a rough target area for the missiles, but with it being a full circle around her it's very difficult to accurately determine my damage output.

Was there a point in development where you decided she was going to look more human? Some of her concept art had her looking more like a half-voidling, with organic guns instead of arms and a more jagged void suit.

It grew into a pretty conscious choice over time, not really an exact moment. But I remember when our main concept artist jumped on it and started showing a clear contrast between the suit and the human inside, while still feeling attached to her, we were feeling it. We liked that it showed another side of how the Void might interact with the world, how someone could find balance with it.

Did you design her with the idea that she would achieve all of her evolutions in a game or for a more pick and choose one or two at most? 

If it becomes obvious that AD or AP are much stronger than her would you want to balance her out so she will always benefit from a mix of the two? 

What do you think about the confusion of where she belongs? She is labeled as an adc and most of the promotion targets her towards bot lane. But she has no tools to survive in that lane and most talk sees her going into the jungle which has proven to be the place oddball adc's go to die. In the future do you think you would tinker her to give her a more obvious lane choice?

Was Kai'sa's void skin inspired by the Dune franchise? More precisely, Leto II's sandtrout skin. Seems very similar in many ways, especially how it can cover her face when need be, or well, just everything about it. Aside from the shoulder cannons. Leto didn't have those.

Hope I didn't miss this, but first question we multiple pieces of lore about Kai'sa, but when boiled down to the bare essentials, it tells us the same thing, the void consumes and people are afraid of her. I see that as a huge missed opportunity. Kaisa's lore is more about the void than it is about herself. Why couldn't we get something telling us more about the suit, what did she eat, why her personality is the way it is, what does she think about her parents? This hurts even more because we aren't gonna get these answers till like two years from now. 

And 2 what makes the void different from the mist? They seem pretty similar

Everything is inspired by something. Was there any characters or anything in other media that inspired you when coming up with her design? Did you guys have a dart board with all sorts of things and you played a round and ended on "sexy, venom, lasers, and sand" or what?
